  1. Oxford 3000
  2. Oxford 16

Words 1501-1600

  1. legal
    It is not legal to park your car here.

  2. leisure
    She enjoys reading books in her leisure time.

  3. lemon
    I like to add a slice of lemon to my tea.

  4. lend
    Can you lend me your pen for a moment?

  5. length
    The length of the table is two meters.

  6. less
    He spends less time watching TV now.

  7. lesson
    Today’s lesson is about the history of art.

  8. let
    Please let me know if you need help.

  9. letter
    She wrote a letter to her best friend.

  10. level
    The water level in the river is rising.

  11. library
    I borrowed this book from the library.

  12. licence
    You need a licence to drive a car.

  13. lie1
    He decided to lie on the grass and relax.

  14. lie2
    She told a lie to avoid getting into trouble.

  15. life
    Life is full of surprises and challenges.

  16. lifestyle
    He enjoys a healthy lifestyle with regular exercise.

  17. lift
    Can you help me lift this heavy box?

  18. light
    The room was filled with bright sunlight.

  19. adj.
    The light bag was easy to carry.

  20. like
    I like to listen to music in my free time.

  21. n.
    She has a strong like for chocolate.

  22. likely
    It is likely to rain this afternoon.

  23. limit
    There is a limit to how much you can carry.

  24. limited
    The tickets are available for a limited time only.

  25. line
    Please draw a straight line on the paper.

  26. link
    There is a strong link between exercise and health.

  27. lion
    The lion is known as the king of the jungle.

  28. lip
    She applied lipstick to her lower lip.

  29. liquid
    Water is a common liquid we use every day.

  30. list
    Can you add milk to the shopping list?

  31. listen
    Please listen carefully to the instructions.

  32. listener
    He is a good listener and always pays attention.

  33. literature
    She is studying English literature at university.

  34. little
    The little boy was playing with his toys.

  35. live1
    They live in a small house near the park.

  36. live2
    The band will perform live on stage tonight.

  37. lively
    The lively music made everyone want to dance.

  38. living
    She is living in a big city with her family.

  39. load
    He carried a heavy load of books to the car.

  40. loan
    She took a loan from the bank to buy a car.

  41. local
    The local market sells fresh fruits and vegetables.

  42. locate
    Can you locate the nearest bus stop on the map?

  43. located
    The school is located near the city center.

  44. location
    This location is perfect for a picnic.

  45. lock
    Don’t forget to lock the door before you leave.

  46. logical
    His argument was clear and logical.

  47. lonely
    She felt lonely after her friends moved away.

  48. long1
    The bridge is very long and crosses the river.

  49. long-term
    They are making long-term plans for their future.

  50. look
    Look at the beautiful flowers in the garden.

  51. loose
    The shirt is too loose and doesn’t fit well.

  52. lord
    The lord of the castle invited everyone to the feast.

  53. lorry
    The lorry was carrying a load of fresh vegetables.

  54. lose
    Be careful not to lose your keys.

  55. loss
    The company suffered a big loss last year.

  56. lost
    He got lost while trying to find the museum.

  57. lot
    She has a lot of books in her collection.

  58. loud
    The music was so loud that I couldn’t hear him.

  59. loudly
    She laughed loudly at the funny joke.

  60. love
    I love spending time with my family.

  61. lovely
    The garden looks lovely in the spring.

  62. low
    The prices are very low during the sale.

  63. lower
    Please lower your voice in the library.

  64. luck
    Good luck with your exam tomorrow!

  65. lucky
    She was lucky to find her lost wallet.

  66. lunch
    We had sandwiches for lunch today.

  67. lung
    Smoking is harmful to your lungs.

  68. luxury
    They stayed in a luxury hotel during their vacation.

  69. machine
    The washing machine is not working properly.

  70. mad
    He was mad at his friend for being late.

  71. magazine
    She bought a fashion magazine from the store.

  72. magic
    The magician performed an amazing magic trick.

  73. mail
    I received a letter in the mail this morning.

  74. main
    The main reason for the delay was the traffic.

  75. mainly
    The audience was mainly made up of students.

  76. maintain
    It is important to maintain a healthy diet.

  77. major
    Pollution is a major problem in big cities.

  78. majority
    The majority of people agreed with the decision.

  79. make
    Can you make a cake for the party?

  80. male
    The male bird has bright feathers.

  81. mall
    We went to the mall to buy some clothes.

  82. man
    The man was reading a newspaper in the park.

  83. manage
    She can manage her time very well.

  84. management
    Good management is key to a successful business.

  85. manager
    The manager of the store was very helpful.

  86. manner
    He spoke in a polite manner to the guests.

  87. many
    There are many stars in the sky tonight.

  88. map
    He used a map to find the way to the hotel.

  89. March
    The flowers start to bloom in March.

  90. mark
    Please mark the correct answer on the sheet.

  91. market
    The market was crowded with people buying fresh food.

  92. marketing
    She works in the marketing department of the company.

  93. marriage
    Their marriage ceremony was beautiful.

  94. married
    They have been married for ten years.

  95. marry
    He plans to marry his high school sweetheart.

  96. mass
    A mass of people gathered in the square.

  97. massive
    The building is supported by massive stone pillars.

  98. master
    He is a master of playing the piano.

  99. match
    The football match was very exciting.

  100. v.
    The colors of the curtains match the walls perfectly.
